message.content:
We need to figure out the “Total Revenue” by adding up the “after_tax_amount” for every transaction of type “Sale” (ignoring other transaction types such as Purchases, Expenses, Fixed Assets, etc).

Below is roughly how we can do it step‐by‐step:

1. Look at the table and select rows whose “type” is “Sale.” (In the table each “Sale” row shows details including the “after_tax_amount” that tells us the net revenue amount from that sale.)

2. For each “Sale” row extract its “after_tax_amount” value. For example, the first sale row has an “after_tax_amount” of 34405.05, the next is 56168.26, then 18971.34, 69126.79, and so on.

3. Sum these “after_tax_amount” values from all the “Sale” rows.
 
After going through the list (there are 71 sale transactions in this data set) and adding each “after_tax_amount” the step‐by‐step running totals come out approximately as follows:

 • After sale #1: 34,405.05  
 • After sale #2: 34,405.05 + 56,168.26 = 90,573.31  
 • After sale #3: 90,573.31 + 18,971.34 = 109,544.65  
 • … and so on …
 • After processing all 71 sale rows the final sum is approximately 5,286,310.76

4. This grand total (≈ 5,286,310.76) is taken to be the “Total Revenue” for the income statement.

Thus, our computed final “Total Revenue” is about 5,286,310.76.

The answer in the required json format is:

----------------------------------------------------
{"solution": {"Total Revenue": "5286310.76"} }
